title.value: Result Diversification in Search and Recommendation: A Survey
title.justification: This title is found at the beginning of the document and accurately captures its content.
title.quote: Result Diversification in Search and Recommendation: A Survey

extractions.description: This paper provides a comprehensive survey on the topic of result diversification in search and recommendation systems. It proposes a unified taxonomy to classify the metrics and approaches used to enhance diversity in these systems. The survey covers both the importance of diversity in retrieval systems and the existing methods to measure and improve it. It also discusses the open challenges and future directions in this field.

type.justification: The paper systematically reviews existing empirical methods and metrics for result diversification, categorizes these methods, and evaluates them.
type.quote: In this survey, we are the first to propose a unified taxonomy for classifying the metrics and approaches of diversification in both search and recommendation, which are two of the most extensively researched fields of retrieval systems.

name.justification: The research focuses on search and recommendation systems, both of which are key areas within information retrieval.
name.quote: Diversifying return results is an important research topic in retrieval systems in order to satisfy both the various interests of customers and the equal market exposure of providers.

name.justification: The other major focus is on recommendation systems and diversified recommendations.
name.quote: However, diversity-aware studies in retrieval systems lack a systematic organization and are rather fragmented, especially in recommendation.
